findings.title: Reentrancy with ERC777 pay token
findings.description: In the removeCommitment function, the transferHelper will be used to return the pay token to the user. However, if the pay token is ERC777, the user can register a tokensReceived callback and exploit the removeCommitment function.

findings.title: Conflicting precondition/definition of userCommited values array
findings.description: The userCommited[index] array is defined as 'accept duplicate' in its addition mutator but viewed as non-duplicate collection in other places, which can be triggered by committing a zero amount.

findings.title: Reusable offchain signature
findings.description: The verifyProof function does not check if the proof was used or not, allowing an attacker to replay the message many times until expired.

findings.title: Incorrect totalAmountPay lower bound checks
findings.description: The totalAmountPay lower bound checks in the decreaseCap and commit functions are incorrect, which can cause totalAmountPay to decrease below totalCommittedAmount, preventing users from claiming their tokens.

findings.title: Checking equality of ratios by integer division
findings.description: The finding suggests alternative methods to check the equality of ratios without using integer division, which can cause precision loss.

findings.title: payToken must not be a fee-collecting token
findings.description: Especially define/document that payToken is not a fee-collecting token, or add logics to handle fee.

findings.title: Typos
findings.description: There're some typos in the name of these variables.
